document.docAuthor: Lina, Almeida-Silva, Charles, Griswold & Antonio, Brescovit

heading.emphasis:
Emmenomma obscurum Simon
sp. reval. new rank

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Emmenomma oculatum obscurum
Simon, 1905
: 14
(Two female syntypes from Monte Buenos Aires, F. Silvestri coll., deposited in MNHN AR 315 , only one examined);
Roth, 1967
: 317
(Syn. with
E. oculatum
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Synonymy . Simon designated two syntypes for
E. o. obscurum
that he described as juveniles.
Roth ( 1967 )
followed Simon’s designation without examining the specimens, since he mention that the specimens are “probably deposited in the MNHN ”. During the visit to the MNHN the first author noticed that there were two vials labeled as
E. o. obscurum ,
both with the number 315 , but one of them was empty. The syntype found was examined and allowed us to confirm that it is a mature female not conspecific with
Emmenomma oculatum
according to its epigynal and vulval morphology. Therefore here we remove
E. o. obscurum
from synonymy with
Emmenomma oculatum
and raise it to species level.

Note . The type locality listed by Simon, “Monte Buenos Aires” is most probably Cerro Buenos Aires (
50 ° 24 'S
,
72 ° 59 'W
) in Santa Cruz, Argentina (M. Ramírez, pers. comm.).

Diagnosis.
Emmenomma obscurum
differs from
E. oculatum
and
E. joshuabelli
sp. nov.
by the sub triangular shape of middle-field plate in the female epigynum (
Fig. 8
A).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Emmenomma obscurum
, ♀ genitalia. A. Epigynum ventral view; B. Vulva dorsal view; C. Epigynum posterior view. Abbrev.: CD—copulatory ducts; ET—epigynum teeth; FD—fertilization ducts; LL—lateral lobes; MF—epigynum middle-field; S—spermathecae.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female ( holotype ). Total length 6.32 . Carapace piriform, length 3.04 , width 1.96 , height 0.84 . Fovea long and shallow. Anterior eye row straight, posterior eye row recurved. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.06 ; ALE 0.22 ; PME 0.13 ; PLE 0.13 ; AME–AME 0.10 ; AME–ALE 0.11 ; ALE–PLE 0.42 ; AME–PME 0.35 ; PME–PLE 0.28 ; PME–PME 0.14 . Coloration (
Fig. 10
G): Carapace pale brown, uniform; endites, labium and sternum brown; chelicerae brown; legs brown with faint dark rings on the ventral face of the femur; abdomen yellowish brown with pale paired spots along the dorsal line, ventral weakly pigmented. Clypeus 0.34 high. Clypeal hood present (
Fig. 10
A). Chelicerae geniculate (
Fig. 10
D), fang 0.52 ; paturon 0.83 ; retromargin with four denticles and four teeth. Labium: 0.34 long, 0.41 wide, not rebordered. Leg measurements. I: femur 2.28 / patella 0.97 / tibia 2.22 / metatarsus 1.88 / tarsus 1.00/ total 8.34 ; II: 2.20 / 1.00/ 2.00/ 2.41 / 0.94 / 8.55 ; III: 2.00/ 0.92 / 1.86 / 2.18 / 0.98 / 7.94 ; IV: 2.53 / 1.00/ 2.50 / 3.03 / 1.29 / 10.34 . Leg formula: 4213 . Right legs and palp spination: femur: I: d 0-2 ( 1 r- 1m )- 3 ; II to IV: d 0-3 - 3 ; patella: III and IV: d 0-1 ; tibia: I:
v 2 - 2
-0-0; II:
v 2 - 2
- 0-1 p, r 0- 0-1 -0, p 1 - 1 - 1 -0; III:
v 2 - 2
- 2 ap; IV:
v 1
p- 1 p- 1 r- 2 ap; III and IV: r 1 d- 1 d- 1 d, d 1 r- 0-1 , p 1 d- 1 d- 1 d; metatarsus: I:
v 2 - 1
- 1 pap, r 0-1 - 0-1 -
1 v
, p 1 - 0-1 - 1 d; II: r 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , d 0-1 p- 2 ; III:
v 1
r- 2 - 1 map, r 1 - 1 - 1 , d 1 p- 1 p- 2 , p 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 1 sap, d 1 p- 2 - 2 , p 1 - 1 - 1 sap. Epigynum middle-field a fused sub triangular plate (
Fig. 8
A) and projecting dorsally in posterior view (
Fig. 8
C). LL each with a very pointed tooth (
Fig. 8
A). Vulva with CD straight and S globose, with a projection on the internal posterior side (
Fig. 8
B).

Emmenomma joshuabelli
sp. nov.
Figs. 9
; 10 B–C, E–F, H; 11 .

Type-material. Holotype male paratype female from Tierra del Fuego, Mission du Cap Horn, Baie Orange (
55 ° 30 ' 51.01 "S
;
68 ° 5 ' 13.90 "W
), Canal du Beagle,
1882–1883
, deposited in MNHN jar 1933 . Paratypes : two females ( MNHN ); one male and female ( IBSP 166058 ) all with same data as holotype .

Note. Specimens of
E. joshuabelli
where found in a vial that included all non-type specimens of
Emmenomma
collected during the Mission du Cap Horn at Orange bay.
Etymology . The specific epithet is a noun in apposition honoring the violinist Joshua Bell.

Diagnosis. Females of
Emmenomma joshuabelli
sp. nov.
differ from
E. oculatum
and
E. obscurum
by the subrectangular epigynum middle-field (
Fig. 9
D) with a sinuous posterior border of the MF (
Figs. 9
D–F) and by the wide tooth of the LL (
Fig. 9
D). Males of
E . josuabelli
sp. nov.
differ from
E. oculatum
by the presence of a cymbial apophysis (
Figs. 9
A–B), by the extra branch on DTA retrolaterally pointed and by the rounded TA (
Figs. 9
A, C).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Emmenomma joshuabelli
sp. nov.
A–C. ♂, left palp: A. Retrolateral view; B. Dorsal view; C. Ventral view; D–F. ♀ genitalia: D. Epigynum ventral view; E. Vulva dorsal view. F. Epigynum posterior view. Abbrev.: CD—copulatory ducts; DTA—dorsal tibial apophysis; DTP—distal tegular process; E—embolus; ET—epigynum teeth; FD—fertilization ducts; iRTA—internal branch of the retrolateral tibial apophysis; LL—lateral lobes; MA—median apophysis; MF—epigynum middle-field; PTA—prolateral tibial apophysis; RTA—retrolateral tibial apophysis; S—spermathecae; ST—subtegulum; TA—tegular apophysis TR—tegular rim; VTA—ventral tibial apophysis.

FIGURE 10.
Emmenomma obscurum
and
E. joshuabelli
sp. nov.
A, D, G—E. obscurum , ♀; B, E, H—E. joshuabelli , ♀; C, F—E. joshuabelli , ♂. A–C. Carapace frontal view showing clypeal hood. D–F. Chelicerae ectal view; G–H. Habitus, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Male ( holotype ). Total length 5.69 . Carapace piriform, length 2.69 , width 1.80 , height 1.00. Fovea long and shallow. Anterior eye row straight, posterior recurved. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.03 ; ALE 0.19 ; PME 0.11 ; PLE 0.15 ; AME–AME 0.11 ; AME–ALE 0.12 ; ALE–PLE 0.35 ; AME–PME 0.32 ; PME–PLE 0.22 ; PME–PME 0.15 . Coloration: Carapace dark brown with a pale area that starts behind the PME and goes towards the fovea where it narrows to 1 / 3 of its width; chelicerae, endites, labium and sternum dark reddish brown; legs brown with dark brown spots; abdomen dark brown with oblique yellow lines starting at the dorsum median line and going towards the sides. Clypeus 0.30 high. Clypeal hood present (
Fig. 10
B). Chelicerae: fang 0.42 ; paturon 0.83 . Chelicerae not geniculate (
Fig. 10
E). Retromargin with three denticles and three or four teeth. Chilum absent. Labium 0.24 long, 0.34 wide. Leg measurements. I: femur 1.75 / patella 0.78 / tibia 1.72 / metatarsus 1.42 / tarsus 0.90 / total 6.57 ; II: 1.70 / 0.80 / 1.54 / 1.58 / 0.82 / 6.44 ; III: 1.66 / 0.78 / 1.43 / 1.74 / 0.77 / 6.37 ; IV 2.16 / 0.83 / 1.88 / 2.18 / 1.00/ 8.04 . Leg formula: 4123 . Left legs spination: femur: I: d 0-1 - 3 ; II: d 0-2 - 3 ; III: d 0- 2 - 3 ; IV: d 0-2 -0; patella: III and IV: d 0-1 ; tibia: I:
v 2 - 2
- 2 ap, r 0-1 , p 0-1 - 0-1 -0, II:
v 2 - 2
- 2 ap, p 0-1 - 0-1 ; III:
v 2 - 1
p- 2 ap, r 0-1 - 0-1 -0, d 1 r-0- 0-1 -0, p 0-1 - 0-1 -0; IV: r 0-1 - 0-1 -0, d 1 r-0- 0-1 -0, p 0-1 - 0-1 -0; metatarsus: I:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 1 sap, p 1 - 0-1 - 2 ; II:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 1 - 1 -0, p 1 - 1 -0, d 0-1 m- 2 ; III:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 1 sap, p 1 sap, d 2 ( 1 r- 1 p)- 3 ( 1 r- 1 m- 1 p)- 2 ; IV: d 2 ( 1 r- 1 p)- 3 ( 1 r- 1 m- 1 p)- 2 . Palp: cymbium triangular, with a proximal, knob-like, median, dorsal apophysis (
Figs. 9
A–B). E short, arising at the prolateral side (
Fig. 9
C). MA bifid with a triangular basal lobe and a rectangular apical lobe, distally curved to the prolateral side (
Figs. 9
A, C). DTP membranous, subrectangular (
Fig. 9
C). TA rounded (
Fig. 9
C). PTA and VTA as in generic description (
Figs. 9
A, C).

Female ( paratype , MNHN ). Total length 6.44 . Carapace piriform, length 2.81 , width 1.90 , height 1.10 . Fovea and eye rows as in male. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.06 ; ALE 0.20 ; PME 0.11 ; PLE 0.16 ; AME–AME 0.11 ; AME–ALE 0.12 ; ALE–PLE 0.41 ; AME–PME 0.35 ; PME–PLE 0.25 ; PME–PME 0.15 . Coloration (
Fig. 10
H) as in male. Clypeus 0.31 high. Clypeal hood present (
Fig. 10
C). Chelicerae not geniculate (
Fig. 10
F), fang 0.50 ; paturon 0.90 . Retromargin with three denticles and three teeth. Chilum absent. Labium 0.27 long, 0.35 wide. Leg measurements. I: femur 1.80 / patella 0.88 / tibia 1.60 / metatarsus 2.25 / tarsus 0.73 / total 7.26 ; II: 1.75 / 0.80 / 1.41 / 1.50 / 0.72 / 6.18 ; III: 1.73 / 0.82 / 1.40 / 1.63 / 0.70 / 6.28 ; IV: 2.25 / 0.90 / 2.00/ 2.34 / 0.88 / 8.37 . Leg formula 4132 . Left legs spination: femur: I: d 0-1 - 3 ; II to IV: d 0-2 - 3 ; patella: III and IV: d 0-1 ; tibia: I and II:
v 2 - 2
-0-0, r 0- 0-1 -0; I: p 1 - 1 - 0-1 ; II: p 0-1 - 0-1 -0; III: v 0-1 p- 2 ap; IV:
v 1
p- 1 p- 2 ap; III and IV: r 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 , d 1 r- 0- 1m ; metatarsus: I:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 0-1 - 1 , p 0-1 - 2 ; II:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 0-1 - 2 sap, p 1 - 1-2 sap, d 0- 0-2 sap; III and IV:
v 2 - 2
- 1 map, r 0-1 - 1 sap, p
0- 1
v- 1 vsap, d 2 - 1 p- 2 sap. Epigynum projected to posterior as a pentagonal plate with a prolongation on dorsal end and posterior border sinuous in dorsal view (
Fig. 9
D, F). S mushroom-shaped (
Fig. 9
E).
